Posts.Content:
that I have breast cancer. I have posted before on the Depression and Anxiety board, that was last September, October..ect. I got that all under control and was feeling pretty good. Now this.
 This lump is very pronounced in my right breast, right under and around the nipple, a bout the size of a walnut, if not bigger. When it started it was smaller and I had a mamo and sonogram done, they came back fine and off I went. about
 three months ago I noticed it changing but thought it was because of hormones. It got to the point it didn't shrink, just got bigger. I was sent to have a biopsy done on Tuesday, I got the call a while ago that it was cancerous. I'm really scared because it's so big! 
 
 I go in for an MRI on the 17th then will take with my doc about
 options. My poor husband is so sweet and strong and I know he will love me and be with me through all of this.
 I have three girls that I need to tell, sometime soon. I worry about
 how we are going to pay for this and what will happen. 
 Eight months ago I was fighting a depression so hard I thought about
 dying, now here I am again. It's so scary.
Posts.Title: Just been told...

Posts.Content:
I have been more focused today and not so "doom and gloomy". My husband and my best friend are taking it harder than I am. LOL I'm the one telling them "It will all be ok" 
 I just want to get through this week and to the 17th to get the MRI done so I know what I am dealing with. What ever it is, I will face it head on.
Posts.Title: Just been told...

Posts.Content: Hugs to you and your family.
Posts.Title: BIL

Posts.Content:
Ok, I went to the doc yesterday and from the MRI, talking with her and my husband, I am going to have a masectomy done on my right breast with reconstruction right after.
 The skin doesn't want to move around the lump, so she thinks it may be attached, so the nipple and all would have to go anyway. I would rather they just take it all and hopefully and cancer cells with it and I can move foreward with this. I go in on the 9th to talk to the plastic surgeon and then the two docs will get a time together to get this all done.
 I'm nervous about
 the whole thing, and not thrilled about
 loosing my breast, but I feel like it's the best choice for me and my family. I have no idea what kind of treatment I will have to have afterwards, hopefully my lymph nodes will come out clean.
Posts.Title: My plan....

Posts.Content:
I've been up and down this week waiting for the MRI to happen on Tuesday. At times I feel so positive that it's all going to be ok, it won't be to serious and life will go on. Then the "doom and gloom" thoughts come in and I think "what would my husband and my children do without me!" 
 Eight months ago I was so depressed and had such horrible anxiety, I had just found this lump and I even thought ..."Maybe it's cancer, then I could just die of a natural cause" Now I'm sitting here in shock because that's what it has become and this is not what I want. Be careful what you wish for huh.
 On the whole I am doing ok, my family is very supportive and loving...my middle one is stuck to me like velcro and I have to almost peel her off of me! LOL I have a husband who is there for me and I am very happy he is,
Posts.Title: Waiting....

Posts.Content: What an experience that was!!! LOL At least the MRI is all done now. My doctor should call me in a couple of days to let me know what they found out.
Posts.Title: Waiting....

Posts.Content: I'm having alot of pain in my right breast today, sharp pains right in the mass. I will be so glad to get the MRI done tomorrow and get moving on this. I found out my insurance should cover almost everything, so thats one load off.
Posts.Title: Waiting....

Posts.Content: For the most part I am doing just fine. At times I feel a bit overwhelmed with all of this and the worries in my head come back. I'm just ready to move on from all of this.
Posts.Title: My plan....

Posts.Content:
Thank you both. I remembered how much this board helped me out throught the depression and anxiety I had, comming back here just seemed like the right thing. 
 I think my husband is reeling from this more than I am. He is he one who always wants to "fix" things and is always there for me. He always figured he would be the one to get something like this, he works around toxic chemicals and such. It never really crossed his mind that I would be the one. He's already said he's going with me to all of the doctor's appointments and such.
 I'm in no rush to tell the kids, but know it will have to be done, but I am going to wait till I have more info.
Posts.Title: Just been told...

Posts.Content: At the moment, I'm really not sure. I have been looking around on the web and getting info and learning more.
Posts.Title: My plan....

Posts.Content:
Thanks Kathy. For the moment I'm doing pretty well. My lump is pretty large, about
 the size of a quarter, I don't know any of the details on it. It's just a lump very close to the surface, it feels like if I cut the skin I could pop it out. LOL, not a pretty image I know, but that's how it feels. 
 I told the kids today, there was getting to be to much talking and I was afraid they would over hear something or hear it from someone else. They took it hard, but we talked it all out and they are doing ok. My youngest is 11 and she took it the hardest, which I knew she would. I let her ask me any questions she wanted and she's doing better now. 
 It will be a long week, but we will get through it one day at a time.
Posts.Title: Just been told...

Posts.Content:
Yeah, it was the pain that actually had me go back in. When I first had the lump checked out, nothing odd showed up. Then about
 four months later it started growing and getting tender, it started waking me up in the night with sharp pains, so off I go again. If it wasn't for the pain, I probably wouldn't have bothered with it for quite a bit longer.
Posts.Title: Waiting....

Posts.Content:
You have to switch insurance companies in the middle of treatment? There is a chance that something may happen with my husbands job and now I have to worry about
 the insurance.
 I know the majority of companies won't cover a pre existing condition. Is there any hope of me getting insurance elsewhere? I'm sure it will cost a bloody fortune if I can. What the heck do people do in this situation? It's scary!
 I should hopefully be able to get through my surgery before anything happens, but who knows. If I can get that done then I only....ha..only...have to worry about
 treatment afterwards.
 Ugh!!!
Posts.Title: What happens if/when.....

Posts.Content: Ok, thanks for the info all! I had no idea how it would work.
Posts.Title: What happens if/when.....

Posts.Content:
Hi Holley, 
 I just found out about
 my breast cancer, I go in on Tuesday for an MRI. I know how you are feeling, I've very worried about
 how I'm going to feel if I have to start any treatments, I'm expecting I will. On one hand Tuesday is not getting here fast enough, on the other I don't mind waiting!
Posts.Title: 41 & Scared

Posts.Content: I wouldn't worry to much yet, just get into the doc as soon as you can and follow up on everything, be on top of it. Hang in there!
Posts.Title: New here and need info

Posts.Content: I'm Suzy, I'm 38 and have just been told I have breast cancer. I have been married 19 years and have three girls, 17,13 and 11.
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share
